3.103 
Form of the marriage contract 
1. The marriage contract must be concluded in notarial form. 
2. The marriage contract, as well as amendments thereto, must be registered in the register of marriage contracts. The Ministry of Justice shall be the keeper of the Register of Marriage Contracts and the Government shall appoint the keeper of the Register. The data in the Register shall be processed in accordance with the procedure laid down in the Regulations of the Register of Marriage Contracts. Amendments to the marriage contract shall have no retroactive effect. 
3. A marriage contract and amendments thereto may be used against third parties only if the contract and amendments thereto have been registered in the Register of Marriage Contracts. This rule does not apply if, at the time of the conclusion of the transaction, the third parties were aware of the marriage contract or the amendments thereto.
